00104 void createConnectionMatrix( Array<int> &con, 
00105                              Array<unsigned> &layers, 
00106                              bool ff_layer  = true,   // all connections 
00107                                                       // between layers?
00108                              bool ff_in_out = true,   // shortcuts from in to 
00109                                                       // out?
00110                              bool ff_all    = true,   // all shortcuts?
00111                              bool bias      = true)   // bias?
00112 {
00113     unsigned N = 0;  // total number of neurons:
00114     unsigned row,    // connection matrix row    (target neuron)
00115              column, // connection matrix column (start neuron)
00116              k,      // counter.
00117              z_pos,  // first target neuron in next layer
00118              s_pos;  // first start neuron in current layer
00119 
00120     
00121     //
00122     // Calculate total number of neurons from the
00123     // number of neurons per layer:
00124     // 
00125     for (k = 0; k < layers.dim(0); k++) N += layers(k);
00126     con.resize(N, N + 1);   
00127     con = 0;
00128     
00129     //
00130     // set connections from each neuron of layer i to each
00131     // neuron of layer i + 1 for all layers:
00132     //
00133     if (ff_layer)
00134     {
00135       z_pos = layers(0);
00136       s_pos = 0;
00137       for (k = 0; k < layers.dim(0) - 1; k++)
00138       { 
00139         for (row = z_pos; row < z_pos + layers(k + 1); row++)
00140           for (column = s_pos; column < s_pos + layers(k); column++)
00141             con(row, column) = 1;
00142         s_pos += layers(k);
00143         z_pos += layers(k + 1);
00144       }
00145     }
00146 
00147     //
00148     // set connections from all input neurons to all output neurons:
00149     //
00150     if (ff_in_out)
00151     {  
00152       for (row = N - layers(layers.dim(0) - 1); row < N; row++)
00153         for (column = 0; column < layers(0); column++)
00154           con(row, column) = 1;
00155     }
00156 
00157     //
00158     // set connections from all neurons of layer i to
00159     // all neurons of layers j with j > i for all layers i:
00160     //
00161     if (ff_all)
00162     {
00163       z_pos = layers(0);
00164       s_pos = 0;
00165       for (k=0; k < layers.dim(0) - 1; k++)
00166       { 
00167         for (row = z_pos; row < z_pos + layers(k + 1); row++)
00168           for (column = 0; column < s_pos + layers(k); column++)
00169             con(row, column) = 1;
00170         s_pos += layers(k);
00171         z_pos += layers(k+1);
00172       }
00173     }
00174 
00175     //
00176     // set connections from all neurons (except the input neurons)
00177     // to the bias values:
00178     //
00179     if (bias)
00180       for (k = layers(0); k < N; k++) con(k, N) = 1;
00181         
00182 }

00226 void createConnectionMatrix(Array<int> &con, 
00227                             unsigned in, unsigned hidden, unsigned out, 
00228                             bool ff_layer  = true,  // all connections beteween layers?
00229                             bool ff_in_out = true,  // shortcuts from in to out?
00230                             bool ff_all    = true,  // all shortcuts?
00231                             bool bias      = true) { // bias?
00232   Array<unsigned> layer(3);
00233   layer(0) = in;
00234   layer(1) = hidden;  
00235   layer(2) = out;
00236   createConnectionMatrix(con, layer, ff_layer, ff_in_out, ff_all, bias);
00237 }

00282 void createConnectionMatrix(Array<int> &con, 
00283                             unsigned in, unsigned hidden1, unsigned hidden2, unsigned out, 
00284                             bool ff_layer  = true,  // all connections beteween layers?
00285                             bool ff_in_out = true,  // shortcuts from in to out?
00286                             bool ff_all    = true,  // all shortcuts?
00287                             bool bias      = true) { // bias?
00288   Array<unsigned> layer(4);
00289   layer(0) = in;
00290   layer(1) = hidden1;  
00291   layer(2) = hidden2;
00292   layer(3) = out;
00293   createConnectionMatrix(con, layer, ff_layer, ff_in_out, ff_all, bias);
00294 }

00307 void createConnectionMatrixRNN(Array<int> &con,  
00308                                unsigned in, unsigned hidden, unsigned out, 
00309                                unsigned memory = 1, bool layered = false, 
00310                                bool recurrentInputs = true, bool bias = true, bool elman = false, bool previousInputs = false)
00311 {
00312     unsigned N;  // total number of neurons:
00313     unsigned k, i, j;
00314 
00315     //
00316     // Calculate total number of neurons from the
00317     // number of neurons per layer:
00318     // 
00319     N = in + hidden + out;
00320     con.resize(1 + memory, N, N);   
00321     con[0] = 0;
00322 
00323     if(!layered) {
00324       for(i = in; i < N; i++) {
00325         for(j = 0; j < i; j++) 
00326           con(0, i, j) = 1;
00327         if(bias) con(0, i, i) = 1;
00328       }
00329     } else {
00330       for(i = in; i < N - out; i++) {
00331         for(j = 0; j < in; j++) 
00332           con(0, i, j) = 1;
00333         if(bias) con(0, i, i) = 1;
00334       }
00335       if (elman) 
00336         for(i = N - out; i < N; i++) {
00337           for(j = 0; j < N - out; j++) 
00338             con(0, i, j) = 1;
00339           if(bias) con(0, i, i) = 1;
00340         }
00341       else
00342         for(i = N - out; i < N; i++) {
00343           for(j = 0; j < in; j++) 
00344             con(0, i, j) = 1;
00345           if(bias) con(0, i, i) = 1;
00346         }
00347     }
00348     if(recurrentInputs) 
00349       for(i = 1; i <= memory; i++) con[i] = 1;
00350     else {
00351       for(i = 1; i <= memory; i++) {
00352         con[i] = 1;
00353         for(j = 0; j < in; j++) {
00354           (con[i])[j] = 0;
00355           if(!previousInputs) for(k = in; k <N; k++) con(i, k, j) = 0;
00356         }
00357       }
00358     }
00359 }
